alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: High Surf Warning issued December 25 at 9:08PM PST until December 27 at 7:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM MONDAY TO 7 PM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously large breaking waves of 25 to 30 feet. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Coast and Curry County Coast. All areas, but especially south-facing beaches and ports. * WHEN...From 10 PM Monday to 7 PM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Strong storm force winds will cause extremely large breaking waves and dangerous conditions along beaches and area shorelines. Waves will inundate beaches and surge into normally dry areas. Infrastructure damage and significant beach erosion can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The peak surf heights occur Tuesday afternoon. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Beaches and coastlines will become hazardous due to very large and life-threatening surf conditions. Stay off of beaches, rocks, jetties, piers, and other waterside infrastructure.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; South Central Oregon Coast
